dc_description_s: The following report outlines the workflow used to optimize your Find Hot Spots result:Initial Data Assessment.There were 3769 valid input features.There were 9 outlier locations; these were not used to compute the hexagon size.Incident AggregationUsing a hexagon of width 8215.6943 Meters and height 7115.0000 MetersThe aggregation process resulted in 536 weighted areas.Incident Count Properties:Min1.0000Max113.0000Mean7.0317Std. Dev.12.5093Scale of AnalysisThe optimal fixed distance band selected was based on peak clustering found at 62584.0539 Meters.Hot Spot AnalysisThere are 51 output features statistically significant based on a FDR correction for multiple testing and spatial dependence.OutputRed output features represent hot spots where high incident counts cluster.Blue output features represent cold spots where low incident counts cluster.
dc_title_s: Hot Spots Insured Sorted Infrastructure: Ohio
